item.title: Việt Nam Seas and Islands Week and Action Month for the Environment 2024 launched
item.description: Every citizen, business and organisation in society plays a vital role in land restoration, drought and desertification prevention, resource management, environmental protection and responding to climate change.

item.title: US, Cần Thơ and An Giang launch effort to prepare for climate change-Induced public health threats
item.description: The initiative will pilot provincial-level models that strengthen the climate change-related “One Health” response across the human, animal and environmental health disciplines and will include working with local businesses and women's unions.

item.title: Environmental pollution remains big challenge for Hà Nội
item.description: As one of the two major economic and political centres, Hà Nội is busy with people and businesses, but that infrastructure overload, along with rapid urbanisation, causes serious environmental pollution.

item.title: Ninh Thuận to build irrigation projects to combat climate change
item.description: The Ninh Thuận Province will build a project to combat drought, erosion and flooding to adapt to climate change with an investment of over 37 million euros (US$40.4 million) funded by the French Development Agency (AFD).

item.title: Green Hà Nội promoted on World Environment Day
item.description: Losses due to air pollution in Việt Nam top US$13 billion a year, equal to four per cent of the nation’s GDP

item.title: School recycling competition collects nearly 9,500 kilos of cartons
item.description: A school recycling competition has collected nearly 9,500 kilos of used cartons in Bình Dương Province.

item.title: Quảng Trị Province's local forest growers benefit from carbon credit sales
item.description: "Everyone feels happy when receiving the money," said Hồ Văn Chiến, one of those who received payment for forest carbon credits in the province.

item.title: Centre opened to serve environmental data integration, monitoring network operation
item.description: The centre helps environment authorities from central to local levels keep a close watch on the quality of water and air environment, as well as waste release by production establishments and industrial zones.

item.title: Việt Nam, EU join hands for clean environment
item.description: The event was held by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MoFA), the Quảng Ninh provincial People’s Committee, the EU Delegation to Việt Nam, and Sun Group.

item.title: Environmental audit to be effective management tool in Việt Nam
item.description: Along with traditional management tools, an environmental audit is recognised as being effective. It is a channel to provide information to State management agencies on the field and to restore the environmental inspection and supervision.

item.title: PM orders intensified carbon credit supervision
item.description: Ministries have been tasked with collaborating to promptly establish a national carbon credit registry system and assessing the potential for emission reduction and carbon absorption from forests, providing a foundation for international forest carbon credit exchange efforts.

item.title: First low-carbon tourism certificate granted in Hội An
item.description: The Field Restaurant, under management of EMIC Hospitality company in the ancient town has been given the Gold Platinum Low-Carbon Tourism Standard certification by Magnus International, a leading company in environmental project management and carbon offsets, making it the first tourism facility in Việt Nam achieving the standard.

item.title: VN needs to prioritise non-traditional energy source development
item.description: This strategic move is crucial for the nation to attain its target of net-zero emissions by 2050.

item.title: Localities expand activities to develop carbon credit market
item.description: The development of the carbon credit market is considered a concrete step towards policies on reducing greenhouse gas emissions, allocating emission quotas, carbon credit trading and creating green financial resources for Việt Nam.

item.title: Việt Nam supports global agreement on plastic pollution
item.description: Canadian Minister of Environment and Climate Change Steven Guilbeault said plastic has become a microcosm of consumer culture since the mid-20th century, adding that the world has depended on this culture.

item.title: Australian man passionately devoted to Việt Nam's environment sector
item.description: Michael, graduated from the University of Sydney and did his Ph.D at Southern Cross University, originally came to Việt Nam as recruited by the United Nations Development Programme and the ministry as a chief technical advisor for a project in 2007.

item.title: Scrap recycling makes many villagers billionaires but causes pollution
item.description: Located adjacent to Hà Nội’s Gia Lâm District, about 25km east of the capital centre, Minh Khai Village (also known as Khoai Village) is often called the village of scrap billionaires.

item.title: Cô Tô calls for actions to prevent plastic pollution in tourism activities
item.description: Authorities have requested local accommodations and tourism businesses to increase the use of environment-friendly and recycled products

item.title: Green building development requires standardising regulations: experts
item.description: Việt Nam needs more regulations on assessing and supporting green buildings, an important global trend for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, according to experts.

item.title: Bến Tre’s coconut trees ideal for earning carbon credits
item.description: Scientific studies show that the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Bến Tre possesses great potential for carbon neutrality.

item.title: Measures should be introduced to balance water supply and energy security: experts
item.description: Not only playing an important role in the national electricity grid, hydropower plants also contribute to flood prevention and provide water for agriculture, industrial production and daily activities.

item.title: Most revenues from carbon credits distributed to localities: official
item.description: The agriculture ministry has issued a benefit-sharing plan and is organising training to distribute that benefit to localities. The main beneficiaries are communities, ethnic minorities, and forest keepers.

item.title: Green energy conversion a key global trend: experts
item.description: Việt Nam aims to bring net greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050, so ideally all means of transport would be using green energy.

item.title: Nearly 200 households in Hải Dương suffer pollution from landfill
item.description: Many villagers suffer from respiratory and digestive diseases and have petitioned authorities numerous times but the situation has not been resolved.

item.title: First waste-to-energy plant debuted in Thừa Thiên Huế
item.description: The Phú Sơn waste treatment plant, invested by EB environment energy company from 2021 at a cost of VNĐ1.7 trillion on 11.2ha, could process 600 tonnes of waste per day, while providing material for construction from ash and power production capacity of 12MW per hour of incineration.

item.title: Quảng Trị conserves forests to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
item.description: Quảng Trị Province is mobilising resources and seeking to reduce greenhouse gas emissions through protection of natural forests and afforestation.

item.title: Việt Nam saves 428,000 kwh of electricity during Earth Hour 2024
item.description: The campaign, jointly organised by the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) in Việt Nam and the Ministry of Industry and Trade, attracted the attention and participation of all 63 provinces and centrally-run cities nationwide.

item.title: Việt Nam receives $51.5m in carbon credits from World Bank, biggest to date
item.description: This makes for the biggest single payment to date made by the World Bank’s Forest Carbon Partnership Facility (FCPF) for verified and high integrity carbon credits.

item.title: Construction units at Long Thành Airport urged to address dust pollution
item.description: The department emphasised the need for effective pollution control measures to minimise the environmental impact.

item.title: Việt Nam to participate in 26th World Energy Congress in April
item.description: WEC Vietnam has launched a series of projects themed “Eternal green – Offsetting carbon footprint”.

item.title: Discarded aloe vera peels cause pollution in Ninh Thuận
item.description: People are demanding that local authorities take action to investigate the facility’s operation and waste treatment amid rising health concerns.

item.title: Ramped up efforts to reduce plastic pollution
item.description: These cooperation and innovation efforts will contribute to a global treaty to end plastic pollution, which is expected to be finalised in 2024.

item.title: Việt Nam and Laos team up to protect water and environment in Mã and Neun-Cả rivers
item.description: The project's overall goal is to enable Việt Nam and Lao PDR to address freshwater resource management and ecosystem health in the transboundary Mã and Neun-Cả river basins and coastal zones by creating an enabling environment for transboundary cooperation and action.

item.title: Hà Nội is seeking effective solutions for environment in industrial zones, craft villages
item.description: The industrial parks and craft villages bring high income, but local people are facing heavy pollution.

item.title: Deputy PM, foreign scientists discuss environmental initiatives
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Trần Hồng Hà received foreign scientists who recently participated in the 4th International Conference on Environmental Pollution, Restoration, and Management (ICEPORM 2024).

item.title: Training course sheds light on emission trading system, carbon market
item.description: An ongoing training course on the emission trading system (ETS) and carbon market has gathered 145 participants from relevant state agencies, organisations, and enterprises, making the first capacity-building activity in Việt Nam with participation from both public and private sectors.

item.title: Rare rhesus monkey released into natural environment
item.description: A rare rhesus monkey, whose scientific name is Macaca mulatta, has been released into natural forest environment in the Chí Sán Nature Reserve in Hà Giang northern mountainous province.

item.title: Quảng Ninh replaces foam aquaculture floats to protect environment
item.description: HDPE plastic is environmentally friendly, durable, flexible, non-oxidizing, resistant to organisms, resistant to big waves, strong winds and can withstand loads.

item.title: Việt Nam, Czech Republic to strengthen cooperation in environment protection
item.description: Việt Nam and the Czech Republic will boost cooperation in environment protection and natural resources management

item.title: Environment ministry drives digital transformation in water resource management
item.description: There will be a push to develop digital maps for forecasting and alerting droughts and water shortages.

item.title: Việt Nam, Japan hold environmental policy dialogue
item.description: This was an opportunity for the two ministries to discuss to open up a new phase of cooperation in the environment, climate change, and plastic waste reduction.

item.title: Việt Nam to develop synchronous and comprehensive carbon credit market: Deputy PM
item.description: The carbon credit market foundation is an opportunity for Việt Nam to switch to an appropriate development model in the future, said Deputy Prime Minister Trần Hồng Hà.

item.title: Đà Nẵng City leads the nation in environmental protection, Hà Nội in 46th place, HCM City 19th
item.description: Based on the results of the Environmental Protection Performance Indicators 2022, the Chairpersons of the people's committees of provinces and cities are urged to thoroughly review and implement solutions to enhance the effectiveness of environmental protection efforts and improve the results of the idex for the upcoming years.

item.title: Quảng Bình focuses on afforestation to capitalise on carbon credit potential
item.description: Participating in the forest carbon credit market will help forest owners enhance the productivity of planted forests, improve sustainable livelihoods, contribute to the protection of existing forest areas and increase forest coverage.

item.title: Environment protection fee proposed for emissions
item.description: The draft also proposed bonuses for organisations that restrict pollutant emissions.

item.title: Việt Nam accelerating efforts to mitigate plastic pollution through NPAP operation
item.description: As the year of 2024 approaches, the environmental ministry was committed to working with organisations and individuals to carry out actions towards stronger and more sustainable goals to reduce plastic pollution.

item.title: Hà Nội in dire need of measures to curb air pollution
item.description: Hà Nội has submerged in the misty air filled with fog and dust.

item.title: Pollution plagues craft villages
item.description: Environmental pollution in craft villages is causing big problems for residents. Garbage dumped and burned illegally has become a huge headache with people struggling to find solutions.

item.title: Environmental Protection and Waste Management Advancements in Bắc Giang Province
item.description: Bắc Giang will actively oversee and regulate industrial production units within the area, ensuring the installation and proper functioning of emission control systems to meet stringent environmental standards.

item.title: Việt Nam shows strong political commitment to maximising green energy transition
item.description: Việt Nam is among countries with great potential to invest in new renewable energy sources such as solar, wind and ocean wave power, and biogas.

item.title: Detailed breakdown of total emissions necessary, even at grassroots level
item.description: Establishing and operating an online facility-level greenhouse gas inventory reporting system is crucial. This is also a significant challenge for Việt Nam due to limitations in awareness and technical capacity at facilities and local levels.

item.title: Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment to support local waste-recycling
item.description: Under the decree, producers and importers of single-use batteries are obliged to contribute 1 per cent of their revenues to the fund to finance waste treatment.

item.title: Mangroves promote climate change mitigation and adaptation goals
item.description: The important role of mangrove forest was shared at an international workshop: ‘Leveraging Plural Values of Mangroves for Climate Change Mitigation and Adaptation Goals’.

item.title: MoNRE issues Vietnam eco-label criteria for environmentally friendly plastic packaging
item.description: There are three specific criteria concerning materials, substances, and fuels; technical characteristics and permissible limits of pollution parameters in the product; and recovery, recycling, processing, and disposal.

item.title: Bà Rịa-Vũng Tàu controls severe pollution hotspots
item.description: Six long-standing environmental pollution hotspots, which had seriously affected the livelihood and daily life of local residents, have been controlled.

item.title: Việt Nam aims big on renewable energy
item.description: From 2023 to 2050, the share of renewable energy in the energy mix is expected to increase from 26 to 62 per cent.

item.title: Investor fined $5,140 for environmental shortcomings in project in Hạ Long Bay's buffer zone
item.description: The decision was issued by the inspectors of the Quảng Ninh Province's Department of Natural Resources and Environment on Tuesday.

item.title: Overflowing waste threatens coastal environment in south-central province
item.description: The high pace of urbanisation, coupled with increased production and tourism activities, has been particularly straining on the environment in many rural and coastal areas.

item.title: VN, Germany successfully cooperated in land environmental management over 2 decades
item.description: During the 20-year cooperation, the two ministries signed two strategic cooperation agreements in the field of environment as a basis for effectively implementing many cooperative activities on land environmental protection between the two sides.

item.title: Climate change reduces Mekong River flows, causing impacts for Việt Nam
item.description: Climate change has reduced the flow of the Mekong River over the past ten years, and causing impacts for the Mekong Delta in the region, including Việt Nam.

item.title: More solutions needed to curb water scarcity and restoration: expert
item.description: The uneven distribution of water resources in Việt Nam not only poses risks to human lives and property, but also leaves many regions facing environmental sanitation issues and a shortage of clean water. Nguyễn Minh Khuyến, Deputy Director of the Water Resource Management Department, spoke to Vietnam News Agency about the solutions to address these existing problems.

item.title: Việt Nam commits to reduce emissions by 2030
item.description: For several years, the expansion of forest coverage has allowed Việt Nam's forestry sector to meet its emission reduction commitments, presenting substantial potential for involvement in both domestic and global carbon markets, noted Trần Quang Bảo, the director of the Việt Nam Department of Forest (DoF).

item.title: Many environmental solutions for a greener Nha Trang
item.description: The waste is sorted with some of it will be recycled into useful objects, and the remaining will be sold to help poor people living in the ward.

item.title: Việt Nam advances national plan to eliminate ozone-depleting substances, meet environmental obligations by 2045
item.description: Việt Nam is told of promoting the carbon credit market in refrigeration and air-conditioning sector as one ways to protect the ozone layer because currently, most substances that destroy the ozone layer and cause the greenhouse effect are used in the fields of refrigeration and air conditioning.

item.title: Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP) crucial for national energy security
item.description: The Joint Energy Transition Partnership (JETP) political statement establishes an equitable energy transition partnership. It is a new and complex issue, but also a global partnership with the goal of energy transition, technological transformation towards green conversion, emission reduction, and the development of a low-carbon economy.

item.title: Environmentally-friendly agriculture the way forward for Hà Nội
item.description: Hà Nội has created 164 hi-tech agricultural production models. The value of hi-tech agricultural products currently accounts for about 35 per cent of the city's total agricultural production value.

item.title: Science ministry issues ISO standards to realise VN’s net zero commitments
item.description: The standards enable to be applied to every organisation at all sizes of local, regional, international, and at all types of business, corporation, sector, and natural resource manager.

item.title: Environment minister, ambassador talk Việt Nam-Canada cooperation in climate change response
item.description: Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Đặng Quốc Khánh had a meeting with Canadian Ambassador to Việt Nam Shawn Steil in Hà Nội on Tuesday to discuss cooperation possibilities in climate change response and related issues.

item.title: Australia announced $94.5m support package for climate change adaptation in Việt Nam's Mekong Delta region
item.description: This is an example of how Australia and Việt Nam are tackling the shared challenge of climate change and energy transition together.

item.title: Capturing earthworms by electric shock poses environmental hazards
item.description: Experts say using electricity to catch worms not only kills them instantly, but the current can damage soil, trees and plants

item.title: Copper factory tailings lake breach poses environment hazards: expert
item.description: The incident, which occurred on August 8, has had a significant impact on 46 households in Phời 3 Village, Tả Phời Commune, where water, mud, or ore entered their homes.

item.title: Việt Nam pushes for carbon market development
item.description: Statistics show that a total of 1,912 enterprises across the country are required to conduct greenhouse gas emissions inventories and meet specific emissions quotas.

item.title: Việt Nam's climate change response looks towards low carbon economy
item.description: The capacity of natural disaster prevention and climate change response has increased. Natural resources have been managed and used more efficiently than in the past.

item.title: Greenhouse gas emissions inventory and reporting manual launched
item.description: The State Securities Commission of Vietnam (SSC) in collaboration with the International Finance Corporation (IFC) held a ceremony in Hà Nội on Tuesday to launch a manual on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions inventory and reporting.

item.title: Recycling old batteries a growing movement in environmental protection
item.description: Triệu Thị Thủy Tiên, a student from the Vietnam University of Commerce in Hà Nội, has been sorting out and recycling more than 300 old batteries.

item.title: Việt Nam supports the global treaty on plastic pollution
item.description: This reflected the spirit of solidarity and cooperation among nations in addressing current environmental challenges, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment’s Vietnam Agency of Seas and Islands has said.

item.title: Standard Chartered accelerates sustainable development of carbon market in Việt Nam
item.description: Standard Chartered Bank and CIX shared experiences in operating a voluntary carbon credit exchange in Singapore and the next steps to set one up in Việt Nam.

item.title: Water accumulation at hydroelectric dams leads to consecutive earthquakes
item.description: Four earthquakes hit Kon Plông District in Kon Tum Province on the morning of July 20 ranging from 2.6 to 3.1 in magnitude.

item.title: Country to promote environmental protection in Đà Lạt
item.description: Đà Lạt is a city famous for its nature, mild climate, and flowers blooming year-round, but it is now coping with harsh natural disasters.

item.title: Migrant workers express gratitude to Bình Dương by cleaning up environment
item.description: Black, stinky canals full of garbage and overgrown grass have become greener and cleaner under the cleanup of the group of young people.

item.title: Workshop on carbon capture, use, and storage explores Việt Nam potential
item.description: With a commitment to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, Việt Nam recognises the importance of CCUS in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, as stated in the National Strategy for Climate Change to 2050.

item.title: Việt Nam, Netherlands tighten cooperation in climate change adaptation
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Trần Hồng Hà will co-chair the 8th meeting of the Việt Nam-Netherlands Intergovernmental Committee on Climate Change Adaptation and Water Management slated for June 25-27 in The Hague.

item.title: Việt Nam active in efforts to reduce carbon emissions from aviation activities
item.description: Việt Nam’s aviation industry and airlines has made efforts in environmental protection and climate change response for sustainable development, he said, adding that the Ministry of Transport always creates favourable conditions in terms of procedures, mechanisms, and policies for airlines and other units in the industry to well perform international tasks in civil aviation activities.

item.title: Huế pilots electric trucks for waste collection
item.description: These are the first electric trucks for garbage collection in Việt Nam.

item.title: Environment authorities to inspect dust mitigation measures at Long Thành airport
item.description: Đồng Nai’s Department of Natural Resources and Environment said it will coordinate with other agencies to monitor the company’s implementation of dust mitigation measures at the project twice a week.

item.title: Việt Nam urged to prioritise renewable energy development
item.description: As energy demand continues to rise and domestic sources of fossil fuels for electricity generation become increasingly scarce, ensuring national energy security has become a pressing issue that requires a long-term vision.

item.title: Red dust pollution
item.description: Farmers in Dong Nai are facing a failed harvest due to red dust pollution from the construction site of the mega Long Thanh International Airport project. The dust is sticking to leaves, hindering photosynthesis and leading to nutrition deficiency in their crops.

item.title: Plan approved to realise net-zero emissions goal by 2050
item.description: Việt Nam is determined to pursue rapid and sustainable economic growth combined with environmental protection to progress to prosperity.

item.title: Project conveys message about the environment through the lens of art
item.description: The exhibition is expected to take visitors on an artistic trip to Côn Đảo Island, where the main events of the LIFE project take place in May. There they could envision Côn Đảo Coastline by seeing its physical elements like rocks, sand, the sound of the sea, and human performances.

item.title: Mekong Delta needs $4b to improve infrastructure to mitigate climate change
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta needs more than VNĐ94.3 trillion (nearly US$4 billion) to improve its road infrastructure in order to boost its inter-provincial connectivity while mitigating the impacts of climate change.

item.title: HCM City, RoK foster collaboration in environmental protection
item.description: HCM City official expects the RoK will share experiences with the city in mobilising international resources to support adaptation and prevention of disasters caused by climate change.

item.title: Female reporters honoured for reporting on environmental issues
item.description: The 'Pioneering Women Journalist for Environment' award ceremony recognised these women's remarkable contributions to journalism.

enclosure.url: https://image.vietnamnews.vn/uploadvnnews/Article/2023/4/1/274983_4495228688716015_Quy Vi Tam Voc Viet trao giai Nu phong vien tien phong vi moi truong (26).JPG

item.title: Transport Debate Competition promote green movement
item.description: The competition attracted 28 teams of students from 21 universities, colleges, and academies nationwide participating.

item.title: Việt Nam carries out measures for healthy forests
item.description: At a forum on the International Day of the Forest yesterday in Hà Nội, Phạm Hồng Lượng, chief of office of the General Department of Forestry, stressed the importance of raising awareness about the role of forests in human life to work together in forest protection and sustainable forest exploitation.

item.title: Bến Tre Province expands forest cover with eye on climate change
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Bến Tre plans to increase its forest cover, especially by growing mangroves, to mitigate the impacts of climate change and combine them with aquaculture to increase people’s incomes.

item.title: Ministry plans to increase environmental protection tax on non-biodegradable packaging
item.description: Expanding the tax base and increasing environmental protection tax on non-biodegradable packaging materials would be considered with an aim to limit the use of these materials.

item.title: Environment pollution authorities call for action addressing air pollution
item.description: Satellite images show that air pollution has badly affected many areas across the country.

item.title: Conservation of wetland habitats contributes to carbon storage
item.description: Việt Nam needs to develop a national policy on operating a carbon credit exchange; and make legal documents on economic valuation of carbon sequestration and storage functions of mangrove forests

item.title: HCM City seeks to build low-carbon city
item.description: HCM City is cooperating with the World Bank (WB) to implement a programme called ‘A low-carbon city development’ towards developing a domestic carbon market.

item.title: Urban development must adapt, help combat climate change: experts
item.description: It is necessary to increase tree coverage to reduce the effect of heat-induced problems and increase the absorption of greenhouse gas emissions in urban areas in order to contribute to realising the target of net-zero emissions by 2050, according to Nguyễn Tuấn Quang from the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE).

item.title: Prolonged pollution from agricultural waste affects people's lives
item.description: The discharge of waste from animal husbandry and farm produce processing are the main causes of rural environmental pollution, which has become more severe recently in a new-style rural commune in Sơn La province.

item.title: Efforts exerted to increase climate change adaptability of Mekong Delta urban systems
item.description: Climate change is posing a great challenge to the Mekong Delta region, especially erosion, landslides, flooding, and pollution.

item.title: Quảng Ninh and smart environment strategy
item.description: Quảng Ninh Province has always paid special attention and adequate resources to environmental protection.

item.title: “No country can fix climate change on its own”: PM
item.description: Speaking at GEFE 2022, the PM said all solutions to global warming require global cooperation, and people must be a central pillar of any successful climate change strategy.

item.title: 'Ring the Golden Bell' contest tackles environmental pollution
item.description: The contest took place on Wednesday at Phượng Hoàng School in Duy Tân Street in Vinh City with the aim of helping students understand the importance of the environment and provide them adequate knowledge on how to effectively protect it.

item.title: US, Việt Nam launch new five-year project to reduce environmental pollution
item.description: Việt Nam faces a series of environmental pollution challenges largely spurred by agriculture, transportation, and industrial production.

item.title: Việt Nam needs to look into recycling discarded vehicles: experts
item.description: Statistics revealed that Việt Nam has 4.5 million cars and 60 million motorbikes currently in use, and these figures are growing.

item.title: HSBC signs deal to help Viet Nam realise sustainability goals
item.description: The ceremony, a COP27 side event, was attended by Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà and Stephen Moss, Regional Chief Executive Officer – Middle East, North Africa and Turkey, HSBC Group,

enclosure.url: https://image.vietnamnews.vn/uploadvnnews/Article/2022/11/13/249944_HSBC va Bo truong Tran Hong Ha thao luan.jpg

item.title: Việt Nam to take advantage of international support in climate change adaptation
item.description: Minister Nguyễn Hồng Hà spoke to Vietnam News Agency on the sidelines of the 27th United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP27) in Egypt.

item.title: World Bank praises Việt Nam ’s climate projects
item.description: A Vietnamese delegation led by Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà attended an event regarding reducing greenhouse gas emissions in response to climate change.

item.title: US pledges support to Việt Nam in energy transition
item.description: US Special Presidential Envoy for Climate John Kerry said the US will work together with Việt Nam to fulfill climate commitments.

item.title: COP27: Việt Nam highlights importance of energy transition in climate change response
item.description: Energy transition is a key factor for Việt Nam to realise the goal of bringing the net gas emissions to zero by 2050 that it committed at COP26.

item.title: Huế goes ‘green’ by boosting electric traffic
item.description: The development of electric vehicles towards green traffic development in Huế City has been seen as a positive solution in implementing the public transport project that the province and UNDP have been focusing on.

item.title: Farmers save wild birds and the environment
item.description: Farmers in different provinces throughout Việt Nam have for years spent time and effort to save wild birds, giving them a home to nest and lay eggs.

item.title: Central Quảng Nam Province speeds up carbon credit export plan
item.description: The pilot plan of exporting 2.5 million carbon credits for an amount of VNĐ110 billion (US$4.7 million) to VNĐ130 billion ($5.6 million) per year from 2021-25 has been agreed upon by the government from 2021.

item.title: PM calls for global approach, int'l solidarity against climate change
item.description: Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính called for a global approach, and international solidarity in response to climate change in his message to the informal Leaders' Roundtable on Climate Change in New York, co-chaired by UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres and Egyptian President on Thursday.

item.title: International partners commit to help VN realising net zero emissions
item.description: The United Nations and development partners, during discussions with Vietnamese ministries and sectors, expressed their willingness to support Việt Nam in achieving the goal of net zero emission and energy transition.

item.title: Việt Nam to improve environmental quality
item.description: A recent report by the Ministry of Public Security said that climate change has become more complicated in recent years.

item.title: US wants to work with Việt Nam in climate change, energy transition
item.description: In talks with secretary of the HCM City Party Committee Nguyễn Văn Nên, John Kerry said that the US and Việt Nam had a good relationship in many areas and needed to strengthen cooperation to quickly to combat climate change.

item.title: US Special Presidential Envoy for Climate visits Mekong Delta province
item.description: John Kerry said Việt Nam, including Bến Tre Province, has the advantage to develop wind and solar energy, adding that this will be an advantage for both countries to work together in the future.

item.title: New regulation on sorting trash hopes to improve waste management
item.description: Representative of the Waste Management Department under the General Department of Environment noted that domestic solid waste is separated based on treatment requirements and into three groups: reusable and recyclable waste; food waste and other domestic solid waste.

item.title: Motorbikes not meeting emissions standards to be restricted in Hà Nội from 2024
item.description: From 2026, vehicles with three to five years of use or more must undergo periodic emissions inspection, and the vehicles that do not meet emissions standards in the zoned area will be restricted from traffic.

item.title: Pilot project collects used beverage cartons
item.description: A programme to collect and recycle used beverage cartons will be piloted in HCM City from August 2022 to March 2023.

item.title: Experts outline carbon-neutral road map
item.description: Considering the effects of carbon dioxide on the global climate and environment, becoming carbon-neutral is increasingly seen by governments as an urgent task to achieve sustainable development, the 11th Congress of the Asian Association of Environmental and Resource Economics heard.

item.title: City businesses told to prepare for extended responsibilities on environment
item.description: Manufacturers and importers in HCM City need to be ready to take on extended producer responsibilities for their products’ environmental impacts, including recycling and treating toxic wastes, a top Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment official has said.

item.title: Việt Nam takes strong measures to achieve net-zero carbon emissions
item.description: Reaching net zero carbon emissions by 2050 is an inevitable development goal, which should be achieved through a strong energy transition and low-emission economic development

item.title: Environment ministry applauded for achievements on 20th anniversary
item.description: Speaking at the ceremony to mark MoNRE's 20th anniversary, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính said that environmental resources are an indispensable factor for human survival and development, as well as the sustainable development of the country.

item.title: Green, circular and eco-friendly economy is Việt Nam's priority for environmental protection
item.description: Việt Nam's top priority in the coming years is building a roadmap, mechanism and policy for the formation and operation of a green, circular and eco-friendly economy, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment has said.

item.title: National Strategy on Climate Change for 2050 approved
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành has approved the National Strategy on Climate Change for 2050.

item.title: Việt Nam, US hold fourth energy security dialogue
item.description: Representatives of the two sides presented key issues in bilateral energy cooperation including clean electricity production, electricity market development, energy saving and efficiency, transmission and energy storage.

item.title: Việt Nam's largest waste-to-energy plant hooks up to national grid
item.description: The Sóc Sơn waste-to-energy project was approved by Hà Nội’s authorities in late 2017 with a total investment of VNĐ7 trillion (US$303 million).

item.title: Đồng Tháp promotes environmental protection among farmers
item.description: The southern province of Đồng Tháp is promoting the reuse of packaging used to contain insecticide.

item.title: Massive whale carcass washed ashore in Quảng Ninh
item.description: According to local fishermen, when being found in the morning of Monday, the whale, weighing about 5-7 tonnes, was in the process of decomposition and giving off a strong smell.

item.title: Traditional markets slow to use environmentally friendly plastic bags
item.description: Traditional markets have been slow to embrace the use of environmentally friendly bags.

item.title: Green Sculpture event raise awareness of environment protection
item.description: A competition and exhibition called Green Sculpture is being held at Estella Place, Thủ Đức City to display sculptures made from recycled materials.

item.title: World’s first zero-emission boat visits HCM City
item.description: Energy Observer – the world’s first hydrogen-powered, zero-emission vessel that is self-sufficient in energy – continues its journey in Southeast Asia, with the 73rd stopover of its round-the-world Odyssey being in HCM City, Việt Nam.

item.title: Trà Vinh Province grows forests to protect coasts, improve environment
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Trà Vinh is growing more forests and strengthening conservation of existing ones.

item.title: Mekong Delta plan seeks flexible response to climate, market changes: Agriculture minister
item.description: Agricultural planning is a crucial part of the Mekong Delta regional master plan that will help open opportunities, Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development Lê Minh Hoan has said.

item.title: Support from other countries key to fighting climate change
item.description: Việt Nam has joined the race to a net-zero economy by 2050 as it was among more than 40 countries that agreed to shift away from coal, one of the biggest generators of CO2 emissions, in pledges made at the COP26 climate summit.

item.title: More needs to be done in Asia to fully unleash its renewable energy potential: MoNRE
item.description: The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment on Wednesday sent a message, highlighting seven focus points to fully unleash Asia’s potential for renewable energy development.

item.title: USAID, KOICA signed MOU on cooperation on climate change, environment protection in Việt Nam
item.description: The US Agency for International Development (USAID) and the Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA) on Wednesday signed the first Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the two agencies in Việt Nam on cooperation to reduce pollution, mitigate climate change in the Mekong Delta, and accelerate the transition to clean energy in Việt Nam.

item.title: Mekong Delta gets support to deal with environmental challenges
item.description: Leaders of the Mekong Delta city of Cần Thơ held a working session with a delegation from Fulbright School of Public Policy and Management (FSPPM) under Fulbright University Vietnam on the implementation of the Natural Capital Management project in the Mekong Delta region.

item.title: Carbon pricing a low-cost solution to reduce GHG emissions in Việt Nam: official
item.description: In a recent interview with Sài Gòn Giải Phóng (Liberated Sài Gòn) newspaper, head of the Climate Change Department under the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment Tăng Thế Cường talks about the potentials of implementing carbon pricing in Việt Nam in its efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: The pioneer in the fight against climate change
item.description: As climate change poses a real threat to the global ecosystem’s sustainability, Unilever Vietnam (UVN) has set out a range of targets and courses of action to take the lead in the fight against climate change.

item.title: Activities calling for environmental protection efforts launched
item.description: Activities calling for environmental protection efforts were rolled out during an event held in Tiên Yên District of the north-eastern province of Quảng Ninh on Saturday.

item.title: Việt Nam has huge potential for saving energy: experts
item.description: For a developing society and economy like Việt Nam’s, energy is the engine behind growth, especially in the post-pandemic recovery.

item.title: Vietnamese students champion int’l environmental competition
item.description: Three high school students brought home US$100,000 from the Earth Prize competition, an initiative of the Switzerland-based Earth Foundation that encourages students to address environmental issues.

item.title: Microplastic pollution found in Đà Nẵng air
item.description: Microplastic pollution in the air in both inner and suburban areas of the central city of Đà Nẵng has become serious. Microplastics can go directly into the lungs during daily activities.

item.title: Project launched to support Việt Nam to spur energy efficiency
item.description: Using energy economically and efficiently is a practical solution to help ensure national energy security, develop the economy, protect the environment and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: Adaptation part of National Strategy on Climate Change for 2050
item.description: Việt Nam will prioritise protecting and managing forests as part of a National Strategy on Climate Change for 2050, enhancing restoration, community participation and employment opportunities in the forestry sector.

item.title: Mekong River's water level in red alert due to hydroelectric dams
item.description: Since the beginning of April, water levels of the Mekong River have been on red alert status, with the abnormal changes caused by the discharge from hydroelectric dams.

item.title: National power development plan VIII targets drastic CO2 emissions reduction
item.description: The latest draft National Power Development Plan for the 2021 - 2030 period, with a vision to 2045 (PDP VIII) has made drastic reduction of CO2 emissions with no new coal-fired power plants to be built in the planning period, and with the switch from coal and natural gas to biomass, ammonia, and hydrogen, according to Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade Đặng Hoàng An.

item.title: HCM City to build on environmental breakthroughs, improve life quality
item.description: Greater public awareness and action, especially in classifying garbage at source, is a breakthrough that HCM City will build on to environment quality in the coming decade.

item.title: Ninh Thuận all charged up over renewable potential
item.description: When the nuclear power plants planned in the province were cancelled, Ninh Thuận quickly retrained its focus on becoming a renewable energy hub, utilizing its natural strengths.

item.title: Việt Nam to preserve vulnerable wildlife amid climate change
item.description: Scientists have studied, evaluated and predicted the impact of climate change on wildlife species in Việt Nam.

item.title: Việt Nam attends 8th Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue
item.description: Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade Đặng Hoàng Ân has attended the eighth Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue held in Berlin, Germany, under the motto “From Ambition to Action”.

item.title: People hold key role in responding to climate change: President
item.description: People and social organisations should be the most important actors in ensuring the success of climate change adaptation process and realising Việt Nam’s sustainable development goals (SDGs), President Nguyễn Xuân Phúc has said.

item.title: Women play a crucial role in climate and environmental sectors: UNDP Representative
item.description: On the threshold of the 66th Commission on the Status of Women which opens on March 14, UNDP Resident Representative in Việt Nam Caitlin Wiesen, spoke about women's role in climate action.

item.title: Việt Nam must scale-up budget for climate change adaptation
item.description: Việt Nam increased its public expenditure for climate change in 2016-2020, however, more investment is needed to address climate risks and to mobilise more support from international and private sources, according to experts at a workshop held on Friday.

item.title: WWF and partners to scale climate solutions for global impact
item.description: A five-year project to transform Việt Nam’s private sector toward sustainable energy use has been officially launched in southern Tây Ninh City.

item.title: Quảng Bình fishermen work to protect marine environment
item.description: Fishermen in the central coastal province of Quảng Bình take rubbish bags during their long sea trips to bring garbage back to land instead of discharging it to the ocean.

item.title: New law promotes awareness of environmental protection
item.description: The 2020 Law on Environmental Protection, which took effect at the beginning of 2022, has timely institutionalised many new policies of the Party and State related to environmental protection.

item.title: Dialogue focuses on helping women adapt to climate change
item.description: Delegates to a policy dialogue jointly held by the Vietnam Women’s Union (VWU) and the UN Women in Hà Nội on Monday discussed the effect of climate change on women's livelihoods.

item.title: Standard Chartered Vietnam launches carbon-neutral cards
item.description: Standard Chartered Bank has become the first bank to launch carbon-neutral credit and debit cards in Việt Nam. All new cards issued in Việt Nam will now be part of the carbon-neutral programme developed with Thales, the bank’s card manufacturing partner.

item.title: Việt Nam considers setting up renewable energy centre to realise net-zero carbon commitment
item.description: The Ministry of Industry and Trade (MoIT) has been asked to coordinate with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE) on setting up a renewable energy centre.

item.title: Việt Nam and partners develop sustainable energy transition in Việt Nam
item.description: With the pandemic still complicated and natural disasters becoming more frequent and devastating, Việt Nam needs to focus on driving sustainable energy transition, according to the 4th High-Level Meeting of the Việt Nam Energy Partnership Group (VEPG)

item.title: PM stresses need for comprehensive approach to tackling climate change
item.description: Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính says there should be a comprehensive approach to tackling climate change, with the grassroots level as the foundation for delivering Việt Nam's commitment in the field.

item.title: Việt Nam to pilot carbon trade exchange from 2025
item.description: Việt Nam plans to set up and pilot a carbon trade exchange from 2025, according to a new Government decree on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and Ozone layer protection.

item.title: Việt Nam, World Bank sign US$127mln credit agreement for climate change adaptation in Mekong Delta city
item.description: The Vietnamese Government and the World Bank (WB) have signed a US$126.9 million financing agreement to improve infrastructure, connectivity and reduce flood risks in the urban core of Vĩnh Long City in the Mekong Delta province of Vĩnh Long.

item.title: Environmental management innovation needed to reduce pollution
item.description: The environment is suffering great pressure from socio-economic activities with an increase in environmental pollution in both quantity and scale, calling for more effective solutions to handle the issue.

item.title: HCMC struggles to implement motorbike emission checks
item.description: HCM City has been piloting a free-of-charge motorbike emission test to remove old and poor quality vehicles from the roads, reducing emissions into the air and improving environmental quality. However, there have been some bumps in the road.

item.title: Mekong Delta to adapt to the climate in recovery from pandemic
item.description: Experts and public officials believe that regional connection and agricultural economic development in the Mekong Delta need to be continued, as discussed in a seminar on Thursday.

item.title: Việt Nam preparing for a greenhouse gas emission reporting system
item.description: Based on the revised Environmental Protection Law approved in 2020 and the detailed enforcement regulations, the Vietnamese government is proceeding with the construction of a greenhouse gases (GHG) emission reporting system for business establishments.

item.title: Việt Nam seeking environmental innovators to combat climate change
item.description: The competition "The Search for Innovative Models to Combat Climate Change and Reduce Damages from Natural Disasters" was announced on Thursday by the Directorate for Climate Change of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment.

item.title: Mekong Delta expands environmentally-friendly shrimp-rice farms
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta is expanding its shrimp – rice farming areas as the cultivation model is efficient and sustainable, adapts to climate change, and is environmentally friendly.

item.title: PM2.5 pollution still problematic across Việt Nam
item.description: Though the average PM2.5 concentration improved slightly in 2020, all provinces and cities in Việt Nam still had higher levels than WHO’s recommendation, according to data revealed at a workshop held virtually on Tuesday.

item.title: Report on climate change in Việt Nam introduced at COP26
item.description: A report titled “Climate change in Viet Nam, Impacts and Adaptation” has been introduced within the framework of COP26 in Glasgow, UK.

item.title: $4 billion investment in climate change response announced at COP26 Summit
item.description: This includes $4 billion in investments to accelerate innovation for climate-smart agriculture and food systems over the next five years.

item.title: Việt Nam's active role in climate change to be highlighted at COP 26
item.description: Vietnamese Ambassador to the UK, Nguyễn Hoàng Long, talks with Vietnam News Agency about Việt Nam's role in dealing with climate change, as Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính prepares for the UN-Climate Change Conference COP26 in the UK.

item.title: Climate-Smart Maps and Adaptation Plans (CS-MAP) launched
item.description: To help farmers manage climate-related risks such as flooding, drought and saline intrusion, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development launched the Climate-Smart Maps and Adaption Plans (CS-MAP) on Tuesday.

item.title: A $30 million project launched to improve water security amid climate change
item.description: A $30 million climate change adaption fund, provided by Green Climate Fund (GCF), has been launched to help small-scale agricultural businesses adapt to changes in water security caused by climate change.

item.title: Việt Nam to plant extra 20,000ha coastal forest to cope with climate change
item.description: Việt Nam will plant a 20,000ha forest as part of a project to protect and develop coastal forests in response to climate change and to push green growth over the next 10 years.

item.title: ASEAN highlights the urgency of fossil fuel reduction and low carbon economy development
item.description: The 8th ASEAN Ministerial Meeting on Minerals (AMMin 8) opened in the form of teleconference in Hà Nội on Friday, highlighting the urgency of developing the circular, low carbon economy and reducing the use of fossil fuels.

item.title: L’Oréal and Lazada partner up to promote beauty e-commerce sustainability
item.description: During the three-month trial period in Malaysia, Thailand and Việt Nam, plastic usage was reduced by the equivalent of 180,000 high-density polyethylene (HDPE) plastic water bottles.

item.title: COVID-19 medical waste needs a comprehensive policy
item.description: Vietnam News Agency spoke with Nguyễn Thượng Hiền, deputy head of the General Department of Environment, to learn more about coordination between localities in treatment of potentially-infectious medical waste.

item.title: “Youth for Environment” project lauded for innovative communication products
item.description: HCM CITY— The nonprofit For Vietnamese Stature Foundation (VSF) is carrying out the second phase of the “Youth for Environment” project with 11 activities including training sessions on environmental communication and participation in field trips with experienced journalists.

item.title: EU-ASEAN Business Council calls for faster action on energy transition in Southeast Asia
item.description: There is a clear need now for ASEAN to address its over-reliance on fossil fuels, particularly coal, for its energy needs, the EU-ASEAN Business Council has said.

item.title: Experts joint drafting decree to concretise environmental protection law
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment is calling for contributions to a draft Government’s decree to concretise a number of articles in the amended Law on Environmental Protection that was approved by National Assembly last November. The online newspaper Tài nguyên Môi trường (Natural Resources and Environment) introduced some experts’ opinions.

item.title: Hà Nội strives to improve environment quality
item.description: Deputy Director of Hà Nội’s Department of Natural Resources and Environment, Mai Trọng Thái, talks to Hà Nội Mới (New Hà Nội) newspaper about the capital city’s environmental protection efforts.

item.title: Cash for carbon: Quảng Nam looks to profit from reforestation efforts
item.description: Quảng Nam has asked the government to approve a plan to export 2.5 million carbon credits for an amount of VNĐ110 billion (US$4.7 million) to VNĐ130 billion ($5.6 million).

item.title: Cà Mau to penalise shrimp breeders causing environmental pollution
item.description: The southernmost province of Cà Mau will fine shrimp breeders who violate regulations on dredging shrimp ponds and cause environmental pollution under a new decision to take effect on July 24.

item.title: Cà Mau takes measures to prevent erosion, adapt to climate change
item.description: The southernmost province of Cà Mau is speeding up efforts to prevent erosion to ensure sustainable development and adapt to climate change.

item.title: USAID partners with Đà Nẵng to accelerate renewable energy
item.description: The US Agency for International Development (USAID) and central Đà Nẵng City People’s Committee have launched a project promoting urban energy security during an online event held on Wednesday.

item.title: First Vietnamese wildlife conservationist receives Goldman Environmental Prize
item.description: Nguyễn Văn Thái, 39, director of Save Vietnam's Wildlife, has becomes the first Vietnamese wildlife conservationist and the only Asian to receive the 2021 Goldman Environmental Prize - the world’s most prestigious award for grassroots environmental activists.

item.title: Report on youth action for climate change in Việt Nam debuts
item.description: The event was co-organised by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) in Việt Nam, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE) and the Central Committee of the Hồ Chí Minh Communist Youth Union.

item.title: New green growth strategy to promote carbon-neutral economy
item.description: The Ministry of Planning and Investment is working with relevant ministries, sectors, and localities to draft a national strategy on green growth for 2021-30 and vision to 2050.

item.title: Coordination needed between climate change adaptation and disaster risk reduction
item.description: According to meteorological experts, natural disasters are predicted to become more unpredictable and extreme due to climate change. Professor Doctor Trần Thục, former director of Institute of Hydrometeorology and Climate Change and president of Việt Nam Association of Hydrometeorology talks to Tài Nguyên và Môi Trường (Natural Resources and Environment) newspaper about this issue and the need to promote disaster risk management.

item.title: USAID launches environmental conservation projects in Việt Nam
item.description: These new projects will help conserve more than 950,000 hectares of forested area across 12 provinces in the country.

item.title: HCM City unveils ambitious environmental plans
item.description: The HCM City People's Committee has approved a programme to reduce environmental pollution over the next decade to improve the city's environment and enable it to adapt to climate change.

item.title: Human capital crucial for Việt Nam to develop renewable energy: experts
item.description: Việt Nam should pay more attention to developing skilled human resources ready for the renewable energy boom, according to experts at an event on energy transition held on Friday in Hà Nội.

item.title: Forum discusses challenges to sustainable energy transition
item.description: Việt Nam has substantial potential in offshore wind and solar power, with huge opportunities for the integration of different energy technologies and the combination of renewable energies and agriculture.

item.title: 2021 National Environmental Report to focus on air quality
item.description: The air quality in many localities nationwide has decreased since 2018, especially in Hà Nội and HCM City

item.title: Climate resilience scheme for urban areas approved
item.description: The scheme, which begins this year, focuses on responding to climate change and reasonable use of natural resources to upgrade and develop urban areas, as well as reducing air, water and land pollution.

item.title: City's new water-drainage plan considers impact of rising sea levels, climate change
item.description: A plan for a new water-drainage network in HCM City has been submitted to the Prime Minister for approval.

item.title: Việt Nam aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in rice sector
item.description: Agencies in Việt Nam and international partners have been working together to seek effective measures to reduce the emission of greenhouse gases in rice production in the country.

item.title: Waste reduced at wholesale markets as HCM City insists on processing before transport
item.description: The volume of waste relative to the total agricultural produce reaching focal points in HCM City has tended to decrease thanks to partial processing at source, according to the city people’s committee.

item.title: Japan supports Việt Nam in building regulations on waste management
item.description: Cooperation in waste management and the building of emission-free circular economy was highlighted at the third meeting of the Joint Committee of Việt Nam’s Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE) and Japan’s Ministry of the Environment on Wednesday.

item.title: Word Bank, Green Climate Fund provide Việt Nam with $86.3 million to spur energy efficiency investments
item.description: The World Bank, acting on behalf of the Green Climate Fund (GCF), has signed a grant worth US$11.3 million with the State Bank of Viet Nam to support the development of a commercial financing market for industrial energy efficiency investments.

item.title: Innovations to implement Việt Nam’s climate change targets
item.description: Youth Union members and young people, as Việt Nam's future leaders, play an important role to implement the Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) targets, said Phạm Văn Tấn, Deputy Director-General of the Department of Climate Change under the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE).

enclosure.url: https://image.vietnamnews.vn/uploadvnnews/Article/2021/2/26/139512_Bà CAITLIN WIESEN - Trưởng đại diện UNDP tại Việt Nam - Phát biểu khai mạc.jpg

item.title: Việt Nam actively contributes to ASEAN environmental cooperation
item.description: Việt Nam will actively join activities of the ASEAN Working Group on Climate Change (AWGCC), as well as continue its coordinating role in performing relevant activities in 2021, according to the ASEAN Senior Officials on the Environment (ASOEN)’s office in Việt Nam (ASOEN Vietnam Office).

item.title: Environment ministry builds digital map, responding to 1-billion tree programme
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment has built a digital tree map in Việt Nam to serve the identification of planting sites as well as management and taking care of trees throughout the country.

item.title: HCM City's major environment and sanitation project face slow progress
item.description: A project to improve the environment and sanitation in HCM City’s District 2 worth more than VNĐ11.13 trillion (US$495 million) is lagging well behind schedule, requiring authorities’ interventions to speed up.

item.title: US shares experiences in environmental management
item.description: Air quality in the capital city fell to dangerous levels in the first week of the New Year, particularly in inner city areas, according to the Department of Natural Resources and Environment.

item.title: Việt Nam vows to strengthen climate adaptation efforts, needs US$35 billion this decade
item.description: Prime Minister Nguyễn Xuân Phúc has delivered an important message to the Climate Adaptation Summit which took place virtually on January 25 and 26.

item.title: New partnership to reduce greenhouse gas in building
item.description: The German Development Co-operation-GIZ Việt Nam and the Ministry of Construction’s Housing and Real Estate Market Management Bureau (HREM) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for co-operation on the joint development of the Vietnam Green Housing Programme (VGHP) under the implementation of the Programme for Energy Efficiency in Buildings (PEEB) in Việt Nam.

item.title: Plastic pollution in coastal area: reported
item.description: Microplastics contamination at beaches, lakes and channels in the central city reached serious levels with100 plastic items found in one cubic metre – up to five times higher than the average microplastic contaminated sites in the world.

item.title: Cities, provinces asked to better control air pollution
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE) has requested provinces and cities thoroughly handle hotspots of air pollution and exhaust gas emissions.

item.title: Hà Nội to inspect firm after environmental workers strike
item.description: The Hà Nội’s People’s Committee has sent a team of inspectors to investigate the operation of Minh Quân High Technology Development and Investment JSC following a recent environmental workers’ strike.

item.title: Long An begins to crack down on pollution of canals
item.description: The Long An Province People’s Committee has ordered relevant agencies and Đức Hòa District to improve oversight of pollution, especially around industrial parks and industrial clusters, to resolve the problem of the worsening state of canals in the district.

item.title: Rice farmers benefit from emissions reduction programme
item.description: Thousands of rice farmers in the northern province of Thái Bình are benefiting from a programme meant to help them adopt innovative technologies and approaches to increase yields while reducing greenhouse gas emissions, a meeting heard in HCM City on December 25.

item.title: Panasonic Appliances Vietnam honoured for most energy efficient products
item.description: Panasonic Appliances Vietnam has received the Most Energy Efficient Products 2020 award, organised by the Ministry of Industry and Trade, for its energy-saving and environment-friendly household electronic products.

item.title: Young man starts initiative to reduce plastic waste
item.description: Phạm Thanh Trí from Quảng Ngãi founded EcoFish Vietnam to teach young people to classify and reuse plastic waste.

item.title: HCM City to improve solutions to climate change response
item.description: HCM City will assess the relationship between the factors that cause climate change and its socio-economic plans to develop long-term responses.

item.title: Senior ASEAN officials meet to discuss environmental issues
item.description: The 31st Meeting of ASEAN Senior Officials on the Environment (ASOEN 31) and related meetings have begun via videoconference to discuss environmental sustainability.

item.title: Hà Nội aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
item.description: Hà Nội will strive to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 15 per cent by 2030, according to local authorities.

item.title: Dialogue discusses strengthening wildlife legislation and communication in Việt Nam
item.description: Strengthening legislation and communication about wildlife protection was the main topic of a discussion held in Hà Nội on Friday.

item.title: VN’s updated climate goals aim at maximising the co-benefits of climate action
item.description: Việt Nam has recently incorporated a new section into its updated Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) to emphasise the socio-economic co-benefits of climate action for the country.

item.title: Plastic waste recycling needs improvement to prevent pollution
item.description: Nguyễn Thị Hưởng, Head of the Hà Nội Sub-department of Natural Resources and Environment's Environment Assessment talks to the Tài nguyên & Môi trường (Natural Resources and Environment) online newspaper on how to make traditional plastic waste recycling craft villages become cleaner and greener.

item.title: Environment ministry seeks to complete regulations on solid waste management
item.description: Measures must be crafted to replace disposable plastic bags with eco-friendly ones at shopping malls and supermarkets by 2026.

item.title: Environmental protection must be at the core of socio-economic development targets
item.description: Predictions on the intensity and impacts of environmental issues on various aspects of socio-economy must be highlighted in the draft documents submitted to the 13th Party Congress, said deputy head of the Vietnam Environment Administration (VEA) Nguyễn Hưng Thịnh.

item.title: Việt Nam, WB sign emissions reduction purchase agreement
item.description: Carolyn Turk, WB Country Director in Việt Nam, said this is a results-based payment and the basic indicators underpinning it are to reduce greenhouse gases in the provinces.
